definition: to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
(phonetic character used in transliteration of foreign names)/Taiwan pr. [li4]/variant of 璃[li2]

sentences.english: The windshield wipers swished back and forth monotonously.
sentences.chinese: 挡风玻璃上的雨刷单调地来回摆动，发出飕飕声。

sentences.english: A mechanical device that cleans the windshield .
sentences.chinese: 擦挡风玻璃的机械装置。

sentences.english: The car stopped suddenly and I was catapulted through the windshield.
sentences.chinese: 汽车突然停下，我被抛出挡风玻璃的外面。

sentences.english: The wipers wiped from the center of the windshield out, leaving a big unwiped V in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 雨刷从挡风玻璃中心划出，划出一个大大的V字型。

sentences.english: Add food coloring to the windshield washer fluid of someone’s car.
sentences.chinese: 在别人的汽车挡风玻璃清洗液里加入食用色素。

sentences.english: There will be fogging, a wet windshield, raindrops and wipers.
sentences.chinese: 会有雾，湿的挡风玻璃，雨滴和雨刮。

sentences.english: My daughter painted a scarlet bear on the windscreen of our car.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿在我们的挡风玻璃上画了一只鲜红的小熊。

sentences.english: Use a wintertime formula in your windshield washer.
sentences.chinese: 为挡风玻璃的清洗准备专门的冬季配方洗涤剂。

sentences.english: Scotch taped the remaining windscreen and carrying on.
sentences.chinese: 用胶布粘牢余留的挡风玻璃，继续前进。

sentences.english: The rain drove across the windshield in sheets .
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱击打着挡风玻璃。

sentences.english: Cab is equipped with canvas tops and ventilatory folding-down windshield.
sentences.chinese: 小室装备帆布上面和通风的折叠的下来挡风玻璃。

sentences.english: They say modern automobile windshields block two kinds of ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 他们说现代汽车的挡风玻璃可以阻挡两种超强紫外线。

sentences.english: Don't try to kick out the windshield; you'll never be able to do it.
sentences.chinese: 不要尝试踹开挡风玻璃，因为那样根本行不通。

sentences.english: The windshield screen itself is electric.
sentences.chinese: 前挡风玻璃的防护格栅是通电的。

definition: car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
mirror showing a view to one's rear (including rearview mirror, side-view mirror, baby view mirror etc)
reflector (typically concave, as in a torch)/mirror (typically plane or convex)
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
